instruction: Fill a large pot with enough water to comfortably cover the spaghetti. Add a generous pinch of salt (or 1 tablespoon) and bring the water to a rolling boil over high heat.
If using, add a tablespoon of olive oil to the boiling water to prevent sticking (optional).
Carefully add the spaghetti to the boiling water. Break the spaghetti in half if it doesn't fit comfortably in the pot.
Stir the spaghetti occasionally to prevent sticking, especially during the first few minutes of cooking.
Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions, typically for 8-12 minutes, or until al dente (slightly firm to the bite).
Reserve about 1/2 cup of the pasta water before draining.
Drain the spaghetti in a colander.
Immediately return the drained spaghetti to the pot and toss with your favorite sauce. Add a splash or two of reserved pasta water to create a smooth and saucy consistency (optional).
